intro: Icianthus atratus, commonly known as the black-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dark green, velvety leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers with a central disk. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
